lessons.title: 1. Introduction to Java
lessons.content:
# ‚òï Introduction to Java

Java is a platform-independent, object-oriented programming language. 

### Key Components:
- **JVM**: Runs bytecode.
- **JRE**: Libraries + JVM.
- **JDK**: Development tools + JRE.

### History:
- Created by **James Gosling** in 1995 (Sun Microsystems).

quizQuestions.text: Which component makes Java platform independent?
quizQuestions.explanation: JVM translates bytecode to machine code.
James Gosling is known as the father of Java.
Primitive types like int prevent it from being 100% pure OOP.
JDK is the full development package including JRE.

lessons.title: 2. Installing Java & First Program

quizQuestions.text: Can a file have multiple public classes?
quizQuestions.explanation: Only one public class per file, matching the filename.
Java statements must end with a semicolon.

lessons.title: 3. Variables & Data Types
lessons.content:
# üì¶ Storage

- `int`: Integers.
- `double`: Decimals.
- `char`: Characters.
- `boolean`: true/false.
- `String`: Text.

lessons.content:

- `String`: Immutable.
- `StringBuilder`: Mutable (Fast).

lessons.title: 16. Wrapper Classes
lessons.content:
# üéÅ Wrappers

`int` -> `Integer`, `char` -> `Character`. Used in Collections.

lessons.title: Memory: Heap vs Stack
lessons.content:
# üß† Memory

- **Stack**: Local variables, fast.
- **Heap**: Objects, GC managed.

lessons.title: 8. if, else if, else
lessons.content:
# üö¶ Conditionals

- `if (condition) { ... }`
- `else if (condition) { ... }`
- `else { ... }`

quizQuestions.explanation: Conditions must evaluate to true or false.
Inside one if, you can have another.

quizQuestions.text: What happens if all conditions fail?

lessons.title: 9. switch Statement

quizQuestions.explanation: Default runs if no cases match.
Common bug or feature depending on use.

lessons.title: 10. for Loop
lessons.content:
# üîÅ for Loop

```java
for (init; cond; update) { ... }
```

quizQuestions.explanation: Usually local to the for block.

lessons.title: 11. while Loop
lessons.content:
# üîÑ while Loop

```java
while (condition) { ... }
```

quizQuestions.explanation: Must update manually to avoid infinite loop.

lessons.title: 12. do-while Loop
lessons.content:
# üîÑ do-while Loop

```java
do { ... } while (cond);
```

lessons.title: 13. break, continue
lessons.content:
# üèéÔ∏è Jump Statements

- `break`: Terminate loop.
- `continue`: Skip to next turn.

quizQuestions.explanation: Allows breaking from specific outer loops.

lessons.title: 18. Methods in Java
lessons.content:
# üõ†Ô∏è Methods

A method is a reusable block of code.

```java
public static void sayHello() { ... }
```

quizQuestions.explanation: Void means no value is sent back.
Can be called without an instance.

lessons.title: 19. Method Overloading
lessons.content:
# üëØ Overloading

Same name, different parameters.

lessons.title: 22. Packages & Access Modifiers
lessons.content:
# üìÅ Organization

- `public`: Everywhere.
- `private`: Only in class.
- `protected`: Package + Subclass.
- `default`: Only package.

quizQuestions.explanation: Private hides from all external classes.

lessons.title: 24. OOP Principles
lessons.content:
# üíé The Four Pillars

1. **Encapsulation**: Hiding data.
2. **Inheritance**: Reusing code.
3. **Polymorphism**: One interface, many forms.
4. **Abstraction**: Hiding complexity.

lessons.title: 25. Classes & Objects

quizQuestions.explanation: The object is a specific realization.

lessons.title: 28. Inheritance
lessons.content:
# üå≥ Inheritance

```java
class Dog extends Animal { ... }
```

quizQuestions.explanation: To derive one class from another.
Java only allows one parent class.

lessons.title: 30. Polymorphism
lessons.content:
# üé≠ Polymorphism

- Compile-time: Overloading.
- Runtime: Overriding.

```java
Animal a = new Dog();
a.sound();
```

lessons.title: 32. Abstraction
lessons.content:
# üå´Ô∏è Abstraction

- **Abstract Class**: Partial implementation.
- **Interface**: Full abstraction.

lessons.content:
# üõ°Ô∏è Exceptions

```java

```

lessons.content:
# üíæ Files

`java.io` package. Use `FileWriter` and `FileReader`.

lessons.title: 39. Collections Framework
lessons.content:
# üìö Collections

A unified architecture for representing and manipulating collections of objects.

- **List**: Ordered, duplicates allowed.
- **Set**: Unordered, no duplicates.
- **Map**: Key-Value pairs.

quizQuestions.explanation: Map doesn't inherit from Collection, but is part of the framework.

lessons.title: 42. HashMap
44. Generics
lessons.content:
# üß¨ Generics

Enable types (classes and interfaces) to be parameters when defining classes, interfaces and methods.

```java
List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
```

lessons.title: Extra: Immutable Classes
lessons.content:
# üßä Immutability

Classes whose instances cannot be modified after creation.

- Declare class as `final`.
- Fields as `private final`.
- No setters.

quizQuestions.text: Example of immutable class in Java?
quizQuestions.explanation: String cannot be changed after creation.

lessons.title: 45. Multithreading basics
lessons.content:
# üßµ Multithreading

Executing multiple threads concurrently to maximize CPU utilization.

quizQuestions.explanation: Parallel literally happens at same time; Concurrent jumps between tasks.

lessons.title: 48. Synchronization
lessons.content:
# üîê Synchronization

Prevents thread interference and memory consistency errors.

```java
synchronized void method() { ... }
```

options: Output depends on timing of threads
quizQuestions.explanation: Occurs when multiple threads access shared data.
Every object in Java has an intrinsic lock.

lessons.title: 50. JVM Architecture
lessons.content:
# üèóÔ∏è JVM Internals

- **ClassLoader**: Loads .class files.
- **Runtime Data Areas**: Stack, Heap, Method Area.
- **Execution Engine**: JIT Compiler, Garbage Collector.

quizQuestions.explanation: Compiles bytecode to native code for speed.
